byline.contributor: Neil Marks reported from Georgetown, Guyana, and Benjamin Mueller from New York.
byline.original: By NEIL MARKS and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Dozens of New York City Police officers travel to Guyana to join mourners in formal Police Dept funeral for Officer Randolph Holder, who is to be buried in his South American homeland; Holder was shot and killed in October while chasing a suspect in Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Crowds lined the streets of the capital city of Georgetown on Saturday to honor a man who was fatally shot in the line of duty in Manhattan. Dozens of New York police officers were also on hand.

headline.main: Officer Randolph Holder Is Buried in His Native Guyana
headline.print_headline: Lauded as a ‘True Hero,’ a City Officer Is Buried

snippet: Crowds lined the streets of the capital city of Georgetown on Saturday to honor a man who was fatally shot in the line of duty in Manhattan. Dozens of New York police officers were also on hand.
